question_stem.en: A 54-year-old man comes to the office due to episodic burning substernal chest pain. His pain increases with activity and improves with rest. The patient has a history of hypertension and hyperlipidemia. He has smoked a pack of cigarettes daily for the past 30 years. His blood pressure is 140/85 mm Hg and pulse is 76/min. Cardiac auscultation reveals a S4 heart sound. Lung and abdominal examinations are unremarkable. An ECG at rest shows left ventricular hypertrophy. A myocardial perfusion scan reveals inducible ischemia of the inferior surface of the heart. Which of the following coronary arteries is most likely occluded in this patient?
question_stem.zh: 一名54岁男性因发作性烧灼样胸骨后疼痛就诊。他的疼痛随活动增加而加重，休息后缓解。患者有高血压和高脂血症病史。过去30年来，他每天吸一包香烟。他的血压为140/85 mmHg，脉搏为76次/分钟。心脏听诊显示S4心音。肺部和腹部检查无特殊发现。静息心电图显示左心室肥大。心肌灌注扫描显示心脏下壁可诱发性缺血。该患者最有可能发生阻塞的冠状动脉是以下哪一项？

question.en: Which of the following coronary arteries is most likely occluded in this patient?
question.zh: 该患者最有可能发生阻塞的冠状动脉是以下哪一项？

explanation.en:
The right and left main coronary arteries arise directly from the root of the aorta and provide the blood supply to the heart. The left main coronary artery divides into the left anterior descending (LAD) and circumflex coronary arteries, which supply most of the anterior and left lateral surfaces of the heart.

In 85%-90% of individuals, the RIGHT CORONARY ARTERY gives rise to the POSTERIOR DESCENDING ARTERY. Such patients are said to have RIGHT DOMINANT coronary circulation. The posterior descending artery runs down the posterior interventricular groove and supplies the posterior one third of the interventricular septum and most of the inferior wall of the left ventricle.

The INFERIOR (diaphragmatic) surface of the heart is formed by the left ventricle (two thirds) and right ventricle (one third), which are separated by the posterior interventricular groove. Because most individuals have right dominant circulation, occlusion of the right coronary artery is most likely to cause inducible ischemia of the inferior surface of the heart. {{exhibit_1}}

(Choice A) The LAD artery normally supplies the anterior two thirds of the interventricular septum (septal branches), the anterior wall of the left ventricle (diagonal branches), and part of the anterior papillary muscle.

(Choice B) The left circumflex coronary artery usually supplies the lateral and posterior superior walls of the left ventricle via obtuse marginal branches.

(Choice C) In approximately 10% of individuals, the posterior descending artery derives from the circumflex branch of the left main coronary artery (left dominant circulation); therefore, the left main coronary artery is not the artery most likely occluded in this patient.

(Choice E) The right marginal branch of the right coronary artery supplies the wall of the right ventricle and may provide collateral circulation in patients with LAD occlusion.

Educational objective:
The inferior wall of the left ventricle forms most of the inferior (diaphragmatic) surface of the heart and is supplied by the posterior descending artery. In 85%-90% of individuals, the posterior descending artery derives from the right coronary artery (right dominant coronary circulation).
explanation.zh:
右冠状动脉和左主冠状动脉直接源自主动脉根部，为心脏供血。左主干冠状动脉分为左前降支（LAD）和旋支冠状动脉，这两条动脉为心脏的大部分前壁和左侧壁供血。

在85%-90%的个体中，右冠状动脉产生后降支。这些患者被称为右优势冠状循环。后降支沿着后室间沟走行，为室间隔后三分之一和左心室的大部分下壁供血。

心脏的下（膈）面由左心室（三分之二）和右心室（三分之一）构成，它们由后室间沟分隔。由于大多数个体具有右优势循环，右冠状动脉阻塞最有可能导致心脏下壁的可诱发性缺血。{{exhibit_1}}

(选项 A) 左前降支通常为室间隔前三分之二（间隔支）、左心室前壁（对角支）和部分前乳头肌供血。

(选项 B) 左旋支冠状动脉通常通过钝缘支为左心室的侧壁和后上壁供血。

(选项 C) 在大约10%的个体中，后降支源自左主干冠状动脉的旋支（左优势循环）；因此，左主干冠状动脉并非该患者最有可能发生阻塞的动脉。

(选项 E) 右冠状动脉的右缘支为右心室壁供血，并可能为LAD闭塞患者提供侧支循环。

教育目标：
左心室的下壁构成了心脏的大部分下（膈）面，并由后降支供血。在85%-90%的个体中，后降支源自右冠状动脉（右优势冠状循环）。

summary.en:
This question tests knowledge of coronary artery anatomy and which artery supplies the inferior surface of the heart. It also tests understanding of right versus left dominant coronary circulation.

To solve this question, recall that the right coronary artery typically supplies the posterior descending artery, which perfuses the inferior wall of the left ventricle. Therefore, occlusion of the right coronary artery is the most likely cause of ischemia in the inferior surface of the heart.
summary.zh:
此题考察对冠状动脉解剖结构的知识以及哪条动脉为心脏下壁供血。它还考察对右优势与左优势冠状循环的理解。

要解决此题，请回忆右冠状动脉通常供应后降支，后者灌注左心室的下壁。因此，右冠状动脉的阻塞是心脏下壁缺血最可能的原因。

tags: Coronary artery anatomy; Right coronary artery; Inferior wall ischemia; Myocardial perfusion; Cardiology; Atherosclerosis; Right dominant circulation
